intro: Ermania microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited ermania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a hairy texture. Ermania microcarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
